summary: Mark A Speiser was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list his name, position, and salary during that period. The documents indicate he was employed by the HSCA for at least a year, from late 1977 to late 1978.
significance: Mark A Speiser's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not specify his exact role within the committee, his presence on payroll and certification reports indicates he was a staff member contributing to the HSCA's work.
